alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 12:32PM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in San Francisco CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Carmel River at Robles Del Rio affecting Monterey County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Carmel River at Robles Del Rio. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Low lying homes from Camp Steffani to below Robles del Rio will begin to flood. Old Odello Ranch near Carmel begins to flood. Homes along Paso Hondo and Dampierre Park subject to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM PST Saturday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise over flood stage of 8.5 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1230 AM PST.
